title: Kakha Kaladze
summary: Kakhaber "Kakha" Kaladze (Georgian: კახაბერ (კახა) კალაძე, pronounced [kʼaxabɛr kʼalad͡zɛ]; born 27 February 1978) is a Georgian politician and former footballer. He has served as the Mayor of Tbilisi since November 2017. A versatile player, he was capable of playing both as a centre-back and as a left-back,[2] or even as a wide midfielder.[3] He played for the Georgia national team from 1996 to 2011. He was voted Georgian Footballer of the Year in 2001–2003, 2006[4] and 2011 and was considered one of Georgia's most important players.[5][6]
